>Lupin licence costs myself, to see how much it would cost to make a comic 
>fighting game. *L* I'll keep my ears open also.

Well, if the Tatsunoko Heroes (Gatchaman, etc.) can get their own fighting 
game I'm sure it could be done with Lupin.  Too bad that IMO most of the 
Lupin III video games (and I mean the ones you can actually play and not 
watch old footage) have been poor.  Lupin is probably one of the better 
series to base an action game on, and yet they haven't utilized it.
.
.
A Lupin *driving* game in 1st or 3rd person perspective would be fantastic.  
Something akin to a cross between  SF Rush/Crazy Taxi, and Need for 
speed/Test Drive would lend itself very well to a Lupin III theme.  Just 
being able to race on that strip of road between Neiss and Monte Carlo that 
you see in the opening of Cagliostro (and in a few other films as well,  
ISTR Ronin used that same strip) would make it a must buy!


Incidentally, a friend of mine who works for VM Labs is trying to get the 
the US rights for Cliffhanger to be reproduced on Nuon DVD.  I explained to 
him the foreign licensing problems associated with the two films that 
Cliffhanger uses footage from (On another note, does anyone know the year 
that the Leblanc estate first heard of Lupin III and exercised their rights 
to the name outside of Japan, ISTR this happened after the Cliffhanger game 
had come out in 1983).  He's already talked to Taito Japan and there doesn't 
seem to be anyone left there who knows about Cliffhanger.  Tokyo Movie 
Shinsha has turned up dry, since they own the footage and care nothing of 
the interactive rights.  He's still checking with Stern Electronics who 
released the game in the US.  If anyone can be of help, it would be much 
appreciated.

Regards,
Rob S.
